intro: Spergula pentandra var. vernalis, commonly known as spring betony, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is a low-growing herb that typically reaches a height of about 15 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers in spikes during the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat conservation.
